text: Which of the following perspectives deals with rules and principles that are expected to shape behaviors?

text: Which of the following concept is defined as a general statement and a sort of obligation that identifies correct behaviors set by an individual or group?

text: Which of the following levels of business ethics deals with ethical problems and dilemmas encountered in daily life?

text: At which period of ethical development, ethical codes in businesses were developed?
explanation:
Completed
Ethics in the 1960s: It is a period where important social issues emerged after two major world wars in the recent past. It is seen that developments such as social unrest and anti-war sensitivity dominated the ethical climate of this period. As a result of these issues, the development of ethical codes in businesses, and the first steps of the social responsibility movement were carried out. Therefore, the right answer is B.

text: At which period of ethical development, income inequality, demands for more transparent management, privacy breach concerns were the main issues?

Completed.

text: Which of the ethical theories puts the benefit to the center of all human behaviors?
explanation:
Completed
Essentially, in utilitarianism, there is a “good” that actions should aim for. In this sense, it has a consequential view. Utilitarianism is an approach that puts the benefit to the center of all human behaviors and defends that the basic element that motivates people for an activity is the benefit. Therefore, the right answer is A.

text: What is/are some of the ethical criticisms for Multinational Enterprises (MNEs)?

options.A: Misuse of natural and human resources by MNEs
options.B: MNEs sell products made from natural resources such as oil, minerals, and timber at a much higher price.
options.C: The local country where such resources are exploited does not benefit from the sales price mainly due to tax exemptions.
options.D: Some local businesses may go out of business.

explanation: Misuse of natural and human resources by MNEs are among the most argued critics. It is criticized that MNEs sell products made from natural resources such as oil, minerals, and timber at a much higher price, and the country where such resources are exploited, benefit much less from the sales price mainly due to tax exemptions or other incentives provided to these corporations. Besides, MNEs can create barriers to entry and economies of scale. As a result, some local businesses may be put out of business. Although they may face antitrust violation activities from local governments, they already create income inequality.

text: How does the communication take place in low-context cultures?

options.A: People are indirect and refrain from expressing their thoughts.
options.B: People are explicit and directly say what exactly they mean.
options.D: They use many gestures and body language.
options.E: They tend to speak with many people at the same time.

explanation: In low-context cultures, people are explicit and directly say what exactly they mean. Latin American, Asian, and African countries characterize high-context cultures, whereas Northern European and Anglo- Saxon countries (USA, UK) are examples of low-context cultures.

text: What is relativism in terms of cross-cultural differences?

options.A: It is the belief that certain ethical values and beliefs of one culture are superior to others.
options.B: It is the belief that ethical values and beliefs must be universal.
options.C: It is the belief that the ethical values and beliefs of one culture are not better than others.
options.D: It is the belief that ethical values and beliefs are the most important factors in business transactions.
options.E: It is the belief that ethical values and beliefs must be studied in order to fulfill business transactions.

explanation: Relativism is simply the belief that the ethical values and beliefs of one culture are not better than others.

text: How is consumerism defined?
